posts.content:
A multiclass human PC with highest level in a prestige class has two other base classes which are more than one level apart (e.g. Assassin 6/Fighter 4/Rogue 2).

If a prestige class is exempt from the multiclass xp rule, does it mean that it could not be considered as a favored class? Would the above example not suffer xp penalty?

posts.author: Ten Pura
posts.content:
Hail Darktooth,
Under standard rules, prestige classes are not considered by the routine which calculates XP penalties. It's like the class doesn't exist. This has 2 implications:
1 - a human with a prestige class cannot have a XP penalty.
2 - any character with 2 prestige classes cannot have a XP penalty.

Hope this sufficiently answers your question!
